editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

editorialNotes.standard: Peek under roofs and rummage through spaceships to track down objects in this delightful time-hopping puzzler.

Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: Terry Cavanaghâ€™s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games weâ€™ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labeled â€œHardâ€), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether youâ€™re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favorites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

editorialNotes.standard: With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.
Juggle impatient passengers by efficiently moving elevators in this minimalist mix of puzzling and strategy.

editorialNotes.standard: Railboundâ€™s tough puzzles are brilliantly focused. Youâ€™re given only a handful of rail tiles to guide train cars to the correct destinations in the correct order, and yet even with limited options the potential solutions feel limitless. Do you lay track so Car 4 goes through a tunnel and waits at a crossing gate for Cars 2 and 3 to pass? Do you create loops to delay Car 2? Do you ignore the crossing gate altogether? Few games make success feel like itâ€™s always just within reach, even when it isnâ€™t. A helpful hint system keeps the difficulty from going completely off the rails.

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AIâ€”and learn a thing or two about yourselfâ€”in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.

Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche youâ€™ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

A well is usually one of the last things weâ€™d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. Itâ€™s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means youâ€™re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone, and laser sights) give you all the help youâ€™ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.
A talking goat ate your grimoire! Relearn recipes by collecting reagents and tricking folks in this bewitchingly fun fairy tale.

The virtual Rube Goldberg machines that make up Perchangâ€™s gorgeous levels are so lovely to look at that you might forget what youâ€™re here to doâ€”move marbles into their proper pipes. With contraptions ranging from flippers to conveyer belts at your disposal, this inventive 3D puzzler requires an intoxicating mix of skill, smarts, and laser-sharp focus.

name: Funny Ghosts! Games for kids
artistName: DOG&FROG Educational preschool kids games for girls and boys, toddlers and babies

editorialNotes.standard: With Free App of the Week, we highlight a great app you can enjoy at no charge this week. (In-App Purchases sold separately.) ZeptoLabâ€™s highly anticipated sequel is an absolute blast, filled with endless charm and brilliantly designed physics-based puzzles. Use all-new allies and abilities to feed the adorable Om Nom candy while navigating each stageâ€™s unique layout and collecting stars along the way. With new mechanics smartly layered onto the seriesâ€™ already famous gameplay, Cut the Rope 2 is continually challenging and engaging.

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

editorialNotes.standard: Part platformer, part puzzler, Edge has infatuated gamers almost since the opening of the App Store. Guide a nimble cube around the narrow ledges and ever-shifting corridors of a treacherous 3D world, unlocking secrets and collecting items without falling into space. Stylishly minimalist visuals and a slick electronic soundtrack make Edgeâ€™s mix of path-finding challenges and pitfall-avoiding thrills easy to get lost in. Its dozens of levels of perfectly balanced gameplay redefine how much fun simplicity and sophistication can be.
